result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory R. Renard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent. 

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. 

If agent deems it appropriate, write a letter of apology to the victim.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory R. Renard

defendant.name: Renard, Cory R.
defendant.address: W12594 E. Town House Road, Alma Center, WI 54611

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Court questions defendant on plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and elements of the crimes to which he plead to.  Defendant understands.  Defense stipulates to a factual basis.  Court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea, and waived his constitutional rights.  Court finds defendant guilty as plead to.  Joint recommendation for probation, concurrent.  Court orders sentence withheld, 2 years probation concurrent.    Conditions:    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  AODA & followup.  S/M employment, CC.  LOA to victim, if agent deems it appropriate.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendnat appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.   Defendant plead as follows:  Guilty to Counts 1 and 2.  Count 3 dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes..   Clerk interrupted proceedings.  DA and defense will discuss the cases further to craft a new sentence.   Sentencing scheduled for 3/2/15 at 1:30 pm
Avoid the residence of Bradley W. REPORT FOR BOOKING
